intro: Boehmeria tsaratananensis, commonly known as the Madagascar nettle, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes various species of nettles. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves with serrated edges. It produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters. Boehmeria tsaratananensis is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of its native habitat.
